result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Lewis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor AMENDED FROM Bail Jumping-Felony, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Concurrent with: Current sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
State asks for plea to Ct. 1 as amended to Misd BJ w/o HO and Ct. 2 without HO.
Plea - G.
BTC:  GUILTY.
9 mo RCJ, I/S, 1 year probation, conc to current probation.
Conditions:
No alc/cs;
FT emply;
CC+DNA surcharge.

  Expungement to be granted upon petition if successfully completes probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Shall reside with father and obey all of his rules and regulations.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Defendant Jerome Lewis in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been  made. Both parties have agreed to modofy bond to a signature bond. 
BTC: Mod. bond to $1000 signature bond-same conditions  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Shall reside with father and obey all of his rules and regulations.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Carl B Johnson.  Defendant Jerome Lewis in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
